name: Black Lantern B & B

reviews.text: My parents stayed here several times while visiting me at Bowdoin College. The bed and breakfast is across the river from the college, but still very convenient. I stayed here for one night and really enjoyed it. The room was tastefully decorated. The owners are extremely friendly and seem to really enjoy what they do. They serve a cooked breakfast to you and will introduce you to the other guests if you end up eating at the same time.
reviews.title: Great! (especially for Bowdon visitors)

reviews.text: The owners really will go out of their way for you! If you are looking for a friendly, welcoming place to stay in the Bath/Brunswick/Topsham area, I strongly reccommend the Black Lantern.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.text: We recently visited Maine with friends from Europe and enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Black Lantern. The rooms were recently re-done and were very charming. The location riverside was quite scenic. And the breakfast was delicious. But it was the hosts who made our stay especially memorable. They are two exceptionally friendly and helpful hosts who take great care of their guests. We went for a ride in our friend's vehicle and left ours in the driveway with the windows open. Well, it happened to rain and we expected to return to wet seats. Tom, the owner, realizing that he couldn't close the windows without a key, covered our car with a tarp to keep everything inside nice and dry. That's really going well beyond the call of duty and it's the mark of a fabulous host!
reviews.title: we had a great time at the Black Lantern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I have stayed in many B&Bs in New England over the years and really fell in love with this one. Everything about our stay at The Black Lantern B&B was perfect - from the location, to our beautifully decorated and comfortable room, to an incredible, generous hot breakfast made to order. The hosts, Tom and Judy, couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating -- they clearly love what they do, and you see it in every little detail.
reviews.title: Our favorite B&B yet!

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights. The kids stayed in one room and my wife and I stayed in another for a special rate for the two rooms. The rooms were tastefully decorated in a traditional old New England style. The beds were comfortable and the innkeepers were friendly. The breakfasts were great each morning. I slept great both nights. The gronds were well maintained and you could walk to the river's edge for a spectacular view.
reviews.title: Relaxing Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this B & B, the owners were very friendly and the B & B was like a home from home. It was very cosy and I think i could have curled up in the bed and listened to the wind outside forever!!
reviews.title: Everything a B&B should be!

likes.liked: — The comfort and space of the inn and the friendliness of the innkeepers.

reviews.text: LOVELY and comfortable, great breakfast and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Best B and B in Maine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky to pounce on a last minute cancellation - lucky indeed. This is a lovely place to stay at an unbeatable price, especially during the high season in Maine. Breakfast was fabulous -- fresh fruit, a souffle, omelet, chocolate chip muffins and fresh squeezed juice -- and Judy even gave us fresh green beans from her garden when we left! The view from our room was gorgeous (water and an old bridge). The bed was a bit soft, but the room was spotless and the breakfast company was lovely. I recommend it wholeheartedly (and I am from New York City..which means that I'm not a jerk, but I have pretty high standards).
reviews.title: Hidden Treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I couldn't have been more pleased with our recent stay at the Black Lantern, our second in a year's time.
reviews.title: We'll keep coming back to the Black Lantern!

reviews.text: Tom and Judy C. are excellent innkeepers. They impress with their professionalism, friendly and open spirit, knowledge of the Topsham/Brunswick area and beyond, and willingness to assist their guests in planning a day's adventure. The B&B itself is lovely -- extremely clean and comfortable -- and perfect for a one-night or multi-night stay. We have stayed in Bedroom #3 on both occasions and are fond of its roominess, large bathroom, and lovely view of the Androscoggin River.
reviews.title: Beautiful, clean home, gracious hosts, convenient to coast, restaurants, shops

reviews.text: If you find yourself in need of a room near Bowdoin College, we highly recommend that you choose to stay at the Black Lantern! We eagerly anticipate our next visit there.
reviews.title: Wonderful part of my visit

reviews.text: We had a lovely time relaxing at the Black Lantern. I should first mention the impressive breakfasts; the first morning we had a popover type of pastry filled with fresh berries and cream, a quarter of melon, and a small omelette. The second morning we indulged in cinnamon streusel bread, a fresh fruit salad, and a crustless quiche. The innkeepers are sensitive to special dietary needs and make every effort to accommodate them. A special treat was the chocolates we received each day in our room. Besides providing us with amazing food, the innkeepers were so helpful in helping us plan our stay. We had not planned much ahead of time, and Tom gave us tips on the best place to explore the Maine coast and the best restaurants in the area. Both Tom and Judy were great resources without being intrusive. I felt comfortable relaxing in my room and on a porch swing on the day my husband conducted business. We would most certainly return here in the future.
reviews.title: A wonderful choice!!

aka: Black Lantern B & B Topsham, Maine
description: The Black Lantern B&B an 1860 circa home located in the historic district of Tosham, has 3 bedrooms, all with queen-size beds and baths in the rooms. Two of the rooms have water views, the third has a gas fireplace. Rates include a full breakfast at a time of the guests' choosing between 7 and 9 AM. Walk to the many fine restaurants in Brunswick, less than 2 miles to Bowdoin College, 10 minutes to LL Bean and the shops in Freeport. No minimum stay.
